Metromaniacs at STC Extended: Don’t Miss It

If you like to laugh and feel really good when you walk out of a show then you need to see Metromaniacs at the Shakespeare Theatre Company (STC). I wrote about attending a rehearsal of the play but was still blown away when I saw it on Tuesday evening.

Georgetown Library Sustains Water Damage

By Katie PearceCurrent Staff Writer

The Georgetown Neighborhood Library is expected to reopen the second week of March following cleanup of flood damage, though the library’s Peabody Room will remain closed for a few weeks longer.

What are the odds that Bradley Cooper was your waiter back in the late nineties at Cafe Milano? If you take into consideration all the mathematical possibilities, it’s probably pretty good: Just do the math.

Kids at an orphange called Flying Kites in Kenya are playing with soccer balls that came straight from Georgetown University.

'Choir Boy' at the Studio Theatre: Don’t Miss this Play

I hadn’t heard much about Choir Boy before friends asked me to join them at the theater. My comment after the show was WOW! This is a powerful and well-acted acted piece of theater.

February Culinary Classes at The Fairmont Hotel

Throughout the month of February, The Fairmont Hotel, Washington, D.C. Georgetown is offering couples culinary classes each Saturday designed to make you a better host and entertainer. Recognized by Destination DC as one of the city's best date night ideas, the classes are sure to delight.

A Via Umbria Valentine's Dinner

Why just celebrate love (and wine) on one day? Join Via Umbria for an extended Valentine's Day weekend where the celebration continues on Sunday. Birthday boy Bill Menard turns 55, so you know it will be a party!

Watching Michael Kahn Direct is a Great Experience

Watching Michael Kahn, Artistic Director of the Shakespeare Theatre Company (STC), direct a play is a wonderful experience. Last Sunday I had the pleasure of attending an open rehearsal for his upcoming play Metromaniacs.

Alvin Ailey Dance Theater Comes to Kennedy Center

Led by Artistic Director Robert Battle, "America's cultural ambassador to the world" returns for its annual engagement for more captivating new works and enduring classics, including Alvin Ailey's signature masterpiece Revelations.
